title: Mauro Icardi banned for two matches after kicking ball at referee while Ivan Perisic also suspended as Juventus vs Inter Milan shroued in more controversy
text:
EFL double blow Mauro Icardi banned for two matches after kicking ball at referee while Ivan Perisic also suspended as Juventus vs Inter Milan shroued in more controversy 
Champions League-chasing Nerazzurri without two of their most influential players following 'Derby of Italy' defeat By ANDREW RICHARDSON Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MAURO ICARDI and Ivan Perisic have been banned for two matches following another dodgy defeat for Inter Milan against Juventus. 
The fixture is steeped in controversial officiating in favour of the Bianconeri. EPA 8 Mauro Icardi will be suspended for two matches after retrospective ban 
And this weekend’s clash was no different, as Juan Cuadrado ’s first-half stunner securing a 1-0 victory . 
Keep up to date with ALL the Inter Milan news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
Perisic was sent off in the late the match, and his absence will be a blow for Champions League -chasing Inter — with the Croatian often proving the matchwinner in recent weeks. 
But being without influential captain, Icardi , will be sorely felt. 
The Argentine finished the match, but was retrospectively punished for insulting referee, Nicola Rizzoli — and kicking the ball at him. 
In a clip, you can see Icardi boot the ball in frustration and it narrowly miss the official’s head, who then asks: “Who kicked the ball?” into his headpiece. 
— Marco Simonelli (@marsimonelli) February 5, 2017 EPA Mauro Icardi confronts the referee after heated encounter against Juventus Related Stories Not so hot, Rod See the moment Jese Rodriguez misses a three-yard sitter on debut for Las Palmas in Granada defeat Yaw a Star Porto in talks with Manchester City over a loan deal with an option to buy for youngster Yaw Yeboah Barca to gazump United Barca are to go head-to-head with Manchester United for Benfica duo Lindelof and Semedo AGUERO RACE IS ON Real Madrid and Barcelona both watching Sergio Aguero's situation at City closely as summer move nears Kant live without 'em Forget Costa, Hazard, Kane and Alli, Chelsea and Spurs' success is down to Kante and Wanyama EPA Ivan Perisic was red carded following melee towards end of Juventus vs Inter Milan EPA 8 Juan Cuadrado’s first-half stunner sealed victory for Juventus over Inter Milan 
Juventus vs Inter is known as the ‘Derby of Italy’ and is historically a fixture decided by controversial refereeing decisions, which often have major repercussions. 
In 1960-61, a match between the pair was abandoned following a pitch invasion and the Nerazzurri were awarded the victory — only for the decision to be overturned and replay announced by the Italian FA, after influence from the powerful Agnelli family, who owned Juve. 
Inter played their reserves for the rematch and lost 9-1, with Omar Sivori netting six en route to the Ballon d’Or . AP:Associated Press Ronaldo is blatantly fouled against Juventus but referee does not award penalty AP:Associated Press Inter Milan players furiously protest after referee awards controversial Juve penalty 
And, in 1997-98, the pair were neck and neck in the race for the Scudetto. 
With just four matches remaining in the season, Juventus hosted Inter in what was described as a title decider. 
The visitors were refused a stonewall penalty when Ronaldo was fouled, only for the Bianconeri to be awarded a soft spot-kick moments later, and eventually win the match — and the title. Getty Images Inter Milan is a fixture steeped in history and regarded as ‘Derby of Italy’ Getty Images John Charles scores a header for Juventus against Inter Milan in 1958 
Such controversy surrounded the decision, that it was even debated in parliament. 
While, Inter were awarded the 2005-06 Scudetto after Juventus were relegated, having been found guilty of match-fixing. 
And, in a 2008-09 clash, the Inter bus was pelted with eggs, while there were seven bookings, a red card as Jose Mourinho was even sent to the stands. Joe Hart gifts Inter Milan an easy goal at the San Siro as Mauro Icardi scores
